de.lmu.ifi.nm.www

Class CiscoAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.nm.www.CiscoAgent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    INetworkAgent

    public class CiscoAgent
extends java.lang.Object
implements INetworkAgent
    The CiscoAgent is the implementation of a network agent and is instantiated by the Satellite. It uses Cisco's onePK-SDK to ... ... query necessary information of network elements ... set static routes on network elements and ... handle network events. Example call chain: getTopology() getTopology() TopologyDiscoverer ---------------> Satellite -------------> CiscoAgent receiveEvent() sendEvent() <--------------- <-----------
    Since:
    October 2, 2013
    Author:
    Dawin Schmidt, dawin.schmidt@lmu.de

    • Constructor Detail

      • CiscoAgent

        public CiscoAgent(Satellite mySatellite,
          java.lang.String applicationName,
          java.lang.String seedAddress,
          java.lang.String userName,
          java.lang.String password)
        Load the Logger, set onPK application name and create a CDPListener object.
        Parameters:
        mySatellite - - The Satellite object which instantiated CiscoAgent
        applicationName - - The name of the onePK application.
        seedAddress - - The IP-Address of the root network element. Used to start network discovery.
        userName - - The username to authorize with the network element. Needs to be configured on the network device.
        password - - The password to authorize with the network element. Needs to be configured on the network device.

      • getTopologyGraphviaCDP

        private void getTopologyGraphviaCDP()
        Get the topology graph object of a network element via CDP. New discovered nodes are added to the global Satellite.myGraph object.

      • listenToAddress

        private void listenToAddress(java.lang.String elementAddress)
        Given the address of a network element, register this as a CDP listener, and call registerSyslogListener.
        Parameters:
        elementAddress - - Address of the network element to listen to.

      • discoverAddresses

        private void discoverAddresses(com.cisco.onep.element.NetworkElement networkElement)
                        throws com.cisco.onep.core.exception.OnepException
        Discover all of the addresses for the given network element Interfaces and sub-Interfaces, and record them. This will allow us to avoid processing the same network element when it is discovered later via CDP from one of its neighbors.
        Parameters:
        networkElement - - The network element where to discover the addresses.
        Throws:
        com.cisco.onep.core.exception.OnepException - OnepException represents a general exception to be thrown by ONE-P API when an unrecoverable error is encountered.

      • addElementAddress

        private void addElementAddress(java.lang.String elementAddress)
        Similarly to discoverAddresses, an address discovered in handleEvent(CDPEvent cdpEvent, Object clientData) is recorded to avoid further processing, and listenToAddress(String elementAddress) is called for the address.
        Parameters:
        elementAddress - - The IP-Address of the network element.

      • setRoute

        public boolean setRoute(java.lang.String sourceAddress,
               java.lang.String destNetwork,
               int destNetworkPrefix,
               java.lang.String nextHop,
               java.lang.String sourceInt)
        Description copied from interface: INetworkAgent
        Set a static route on a network element.
        Specified by:
        setRoute in interface INetworkAgent
        Parameters:
        sourceAddress - - The source IP-Address of the network element where to configure the route.
        destNetwork - - The destination network address.
        destNetworkPrefix - - The destination subnet mask or prefix.
        nextHop - - The IP-Address of the next hop.
        sourceInt - - The source interface of the network element where to configure the route.
        Returns:
        True or false whether a route has been placed successfully or not.

      • getInterfaceHash

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.List<NetworkPrefix>> getInterfaceHash()
        Get all available interfaces of the network element.
        Returns:
        A HashMap where the key is the interface name and the value a list of NetworkPrefix objects. A NetworkPrefix object consists of an address and a prefix, e.g. 10.1.0.0/24.
